column4: how can you explain that the out put of whatsmyip.com is not the same as the ip shown in ifconfig?
you have some device doing NAT? a router or most dsl modems for instance ?
Is there any way to know which IP is correct?
most DSL modems are actually "routers" also, you can hook up a switch and multiple computers without  a separate router
they are both correct, one is external and one is internal
to ssh in from outside you use the external, but you also need to set a port forward in the modem
pretty simple usually, go to http://192.168.1.1 which is most likely the modem's internal address, and configure it there, checkout portforward.com if you need help
no, this is a common and desirable setup, so your internal computers are "firewalled" from the internet
and you can hook up more than one
your ISP's website probably has documentation on this, as does portforward.com
what do I look for in portfoward?
window's ipconfig saying the default gateway is 192.168.2.1
now, how do I do the port forward?
do you have a router or just the modem?
yes then you need to go to the router config and forward port 22 to the linux machine
